description: Most newspapers featured the deal that ended 53 years of diplomatic estrangement between the United States and Cuba on their front pages.
title: Historic Shift in Cuba-U.S. Relations, as Told by Newspapers Around the World
title_page: Historic Shift in Cuba-U.S. Relations, as Told by Newspapers Around the World - The New York Times
text:
Cuba’s state-run newspaper, Granma, focused its headline on the three Cuban spies released by the United States as part of the sudden diplomatic thaw in relations. The headline and first summary read, “They Returned! As Fidel promised in June of 2001, when he said, ‘They will return!’ they reached our homeland, Gerardo, Ramón and Antonio.”
Under the image of President Raúl Castro reads a quote from his speech yesterday, “We must learn the art of coexisting with our differences in a civilized manner.”
President Obama’s speech was also translated, “In those aspects in which we do not agree, we will approach these differences directly.”
